intro: Leonurus heterophyllus f. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered hedgehog plant, is a variant of the hedgehog plant species native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a hairy texture, contributing to its unique appearance. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate flowers and compact growth habit.
